00019 // make a namespace for our parser to save writing boost::spirit:: all the time
00020 namespace spt=boost::spirit;
00021 
00022 // syntactic sugar for specifying our grammar
00023 typedef spt::rule<spt::phrase_scanner_t> srule;

00026 ModelLODTri::~ModelLODTri()
00027 {
00028   for ( unsigned int i=0; i < m_lodVertex.size(); ++i)
00029   {
00030     delete(m_lodVertex[i]);
00031   }
00032 
00033   for ( unsigned int i=0; i < m_lodTriangle.size(); ++i)
00034   {
00035     delete(m_lodTriangle[i]);
00036   }
00037 
00038   clearVtxTriDataOut();
00039 
00040 }

00042 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00043 bool compareVertexCost(Vertex*& a, Vertex*& b)
00044 {
00045   return (a->getCollapseCost() < b->getCollapseCost());
00046 }

00048 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 // parse a vertex
00050 void ModelLODTri::parseVertex( const char *_begin )
00051 {
00052   std::vector<ngl::Real> values;
00053   // here is the parse rule to load the data into a vector (above)
00054   srule vertex = "v" >> spt::real_p[spt::append(values)] >>
00055                         spt::real_p[spt::append(values)] >>
00056                         spt::real_p[spt::append(values)];
00057   // now parse the data
00058   spt::parse_info<> result = spt::parse(_begin, vertex, spt::space_p);
00059   // should check this at some stage
00060   NGL_UNUSED(result);
00061   // and add it to our vert list in abstact mesh parent
00062   m_verts.push_back(ngl::Vec3(values[0],values[1],values[2]));
00063   // add the vertex id and value to my custom Vertex class
00064   m_lodVertex.push_back(new Vertex(m_verts.size()-1, ngl::Vec3(values[0],values[1],values[2])));
00065 }

00068 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00069 // parse a texture coordinate
00070 void ModelLODTri::parseTextureCoordinate(const char * _begin )
00071 {
00072   std::vector<ngl::Real> values;
00073   // generate our parse rule for a tex cord,
00074   // this can be either a 2 or 3 d text so the *rule looks for an additional one
00075   srule texcord = "vt" >> spt::real_p[spt::append(values)] >>
00076                           spt::real_p[spt::append(values)] >>
00077                           *(spt::real_p[spt::append(values)]);
00078   spt::parse_info<> result = spt::parse(_begin, texcord, spt::space_p);
00079   // should check the return values at some stage
00080   NGL_UNUSED(result);
00081 
00082   // build tex cord
00083   // if we have a value use it other wise set to 0
00084   ngl::Real vt3 = values.size() == 3 ? values[2] : 0.0f;
00085   m_tex.push_back(ngl::Vec3(values[0],values[1],vt3));
00086 }
00087 
00088 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00089 // parse a normal
00090 void ModelLODTri::parseNormal( const char *_begin )
00091 {
00092   std::vector<ngl::Real> values;
00093   // here is our rule for normals
00094   srule norm = "vn" >> spt::real_p[spt::append(values)] >>
00095                        spt::real_p[spt::append(values)] >>
00096                        spt::real_p[spt::append(values)];
00097   // parse and push back to the list
00098   spt::parse_info<> result = spt::parse(_begin, norm, spt::space_p);
00099   // should check the return values at some stage
00100   NGL_UNUSED(result);
00101   m_norm.push_back(ngl::Vec3(values[0],values[1],values[2]));
00102 }

00104 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00105 // parse face
00106 void ModelLODTri::parseFace(const char * _begin   )
00107 {
00108   int k =0;
00109   // ok this one is quite complex first create some lists for our face data
00110   // list to hold the vertex data indices
00111   std::vector<int> vec;
00112   // list to hold the tex cord indices
00113   std::vector<int> tvec;
00114   // list to hold the normal indices
00115   std::vector<int> nvec;
00116 
00117   // create the parse rule for a face entry V/T/N
00118   // so our entry can be always a vert, followed by optional t and norm seperated by /
00119   // also it is possible to have just a V value with no / so the rule should do all this
00120   srule entry = spt::int_p[spt::append(vec)] >>
00121     (
00122       ("/" >> (spt::int_p[spt::append(tvec)] | spt::epsilon_p) >>
00123        "/" >> (spt::int_p[spt::append(nvec)] | spt::epsilon_p)
00124       )
00125       | spt::epsilon_p
00126     );
00127   // a face has at least 3 of the above entries plus many optional ones
00128   srule face = "f"  >> entry >> entry >> entry >> *(entry);
00129   // now we've done this we can parse
00130   spt::parse(_begin, face, spt::space_p);
00131 
00132   unsigned int numVerts=vec.size();
00133   // so now build a face structure.
00134   ngl::Face f;
00135   // create my triangle face structure.
00136   Triangle* lodTri = new Triangle(m_lodTriangle.size());
00137   // verts are -1 the size
00138   f.m_numVerts=numVerts-1;
00139   f.m_textureCoord=false;
00140   f.m_normals=false;
00141   // copy the vertex indices into our face data structure index in obj start from 1
00142   // so we need to do -1 for our array index
00143   BOOST_FOREACH(int i, vec)
00144   {
00145     f.m_vert.push_back(i-1);
00146     // store the Vertex class info in the triangle
00147     lodTri->m_vert.push_back(m_lodVertex[i-1]);
00148   }
00149 
00150   // copy the Vertex class value into the adjacent vertex for each vertex class
00151   // and add the adjacent triangles to each vertex.
00152   for (unsigned int i=0; i<vec.size(); i++)
00153   {
00154     for (unsigned int j=0; j<vec.size(); j++)
00155     {
00156       if (i!=j)
00157       {
00158         m_lodVertex[vec[i]-1]->addAdjVert(m_lodVertex[vec[j]-1]);
00159       }
00160     }
00161     m_lodVertex[vec[i]-1]->addAdjFace(lodTri);
00162   }
00163 
00164   // merge in texture coordinates and normals, if present
00165   // OBJ format requires an encoding for faces which uses one of the vertex/texture/normal specifications
00166   // consistently across the entire face.  eg. we can have all v/vt/vn, or all v//vn, or all v, but not
00167   // v//vn then v/vt/vn ...
00168   if(!nvec.empty())
00169   {
00170     if(nvec.size() != vec.size())
00171     {
00172      std::cerr <<"Something wrong with the face data will continue but may not be correct\n";
00173     }
00174 
00175     // copy in these references to normal vectors to the mesh's normal vector
00176     // also, add the value to the triangle as well as the ID
00177     k =0;
00178     BOOST_FOREACH(int i, nvec)
00179     {
00180       f.m_norm.push_back(i-1);
00181       // add the value and ID to the Triangle class
00182       lodTri->m_norm.push_back(m_norm[i-1]);
00183       lodTri->setNormID(i-1,k);
00184       k++;
00185     }
00186     f.m_normals=true;
00187     lodTri->m_normals=true;
00188   }
00189 
00190   //
00191   // merge in texture coordinates, if present
00192   //
00193   if(!tvec.empty())
00194   {
00195     if(tvec.size() != vec.size())
00196     {
00197      std::cerr <<"Something wrong with the face data will continue but may not be correct\n";
00198     }
00199     k = 0;
00200     // copy in these references to texture vectors to the mesh's texture vector
00201     // also, add the value to the triangle as well as the ID
00202     BOOST_FOREACH(int i, tvec)
00203     {
00204       f.m_tex.push_back(i-1);
00205       // add the value and ID to the Triangle class
00206       lodTri->m_tex.push_back(m_tex[i-1]);
00207       lodTri->setTexID(i-1, k);
00208     }
00209 
00210     f.m_textureCoord=true;
00211     lodTri->m_textureCoord=true;
00212 
00213   }
00214   // Calculate the triangle face normal
00215   lodTri->calculateNormal();
00216 
00217   // finally save the face into our face list
00218   m_face.push_back(f);
00219   // save the lod triangle to the triangle list
00220   m_lodTriangle.push_back(lodTri);
00221 }

00223 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00224 bool ModelLODTri::load(const std::string &_fname,bool _calcBB )
00225 {
00226  // here we build up our ebnf rules for parsing
00227   // so first we have a comment
00228   srule comment = spt::comment_p("#");
00229 
00230   // see below for the rest of the obj spec and other good format data
00231   // http://local.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/dataformats/obj/
00232 
00233   // vertices rule v is a parse of 3 reals and we run the parseVertex function
00234   srule vertex= ("v"  >> spt::real_p >> spt::real_p >> spt::real_p) [bind(&ModelLODTri::parseVertex,boost::ref(*this), _1)];
00235   // our tex rule and binding of the parse function
00236   srule tex= ("vt" >> spt::real_p >> spt::real_p) [bind(&ModelLODTri::parseTextureCoordinate, boost::ref(*this), _1)];
00237   // the normal rule and parsing function
00238   srule norm= ("vn" >> spt::real_p >> spt::real_p >> spt::real_p) [bind(&ModelLODTri::parseNormal,boost::ref(*this), _1)];
00239 
00240   // our vertex data can be any of the above values
00241   srule vertex_type = vertex | tex | norm;
00242 
00243   // the rule for the face and parser
00244   srule  face = (spt::ch_p('f') >> *(spt::anychar_p))[bind(&ModelLODTri::parseFace, boost::ref(*this), _1)];
00245   // open the file to parse
00246   std::ifstream in(_fname.c_str());
00247   if (in.is_open() != true)
00248   {
00249     std::cout<<"FILE NOT FOUND !!!! "<<_fname.c_str()<<"\n";
00250     return false;
00251 
00252   }
00253   std::string str;
00254   // loop grabbing a line and then pass it to our parsing framework
00255   while(getline(in, str))
00256   {
00257     spt::parse(str.c_str(), vertex_type  | face | comment, spt::space_p);
00258   }
00259   // now we are done close the file
00260   in.close();
00261 
00262   // grab the sizes used for drawing later
00263   m_nVerts=m_verts.size();
00264   m_nNorm=m_norm.size();
00265   m_nTex=m_tex.size();
00266   m_nFaces=m_face.size();
00267 
00268   // Calculate the Edge Collapse costs at the start
00269   calculateAllEColCosts();
00270 
00271   // Calculate the center of the object.
00272   if(_calcBB == true)
00273   {
00274     this->calcDimensions();
00275   }
00276   return true;
00277 
00278 }

00281 ModelLODTri::ModelLODTri( const std::string& _fname  ) :AbstractMesh()
00282 {
00283     m_vbo=false;
00284     m_ext=0;
00285     // set default values
00286     m_nVerts=m_nNorm=m_nTex=m_nFaces=0;
00287     //set the default extents to 0
00288     m_maxX=0.0f; m_maxY=0.0f; m_maxZ=0.0f;
00289     m_minX=0.0f; m_minY=0.0f; m_minZ=0.0f;
00290     m_nNorm=m_nTex=0;
00291 
00292     // load the file in
00293     m_loaded=load(_fname);
00294 
00295     m_texture = false;
00296 }

00317 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00318 ModelLODTri::ModelLODTri( ModelLODTri& _m )
00319 {
00320   // clone data from lodVertexOut and lodTriangle out
00321   vtxTriData mVtxTriOut = _m.copyVtxTriData(_m.m_lodVertexOut, _m.m_lodTriangleOut);
00322 
00323   // store the cloned data into the lodVertex and lodTriangle locations
00324   m_lodVertex = mVtxTriOut.vtxData;
00325   m_lodTriangle = mVtxTriOut.triData;
00326 
00327   m_vbo=false;
00328   m_vao=false;
00329   m_ext=0;
00330   // set default values
00331   m_nVerts=m_nNorm=m_nTex=m_nFaces=0;
00332   m_loaded = true;
00333   m_texture = false;
00334   m_maxX=0.0f; m_maxY=0.0f; m_maxZ=0.0f;
00335   m_minX=0.0f; m_minY=0.0f; m_minZ=0.0f;
00336 
00337   // resize to make data allocation quicker
00338   m_face.resize(m_lodTriangle.size());
00339 
00340   // store maps for old and new ids so to renumber them correctly without adding
00341   // two of the same values to the lists
00342   std::map <int, int> oldNewIDVtxMatch;
00343   std::map <int, int> oldNewIDNormMatch;
00344   std::map <int, int> oldNewIDTexMatch;
00345 
00346   // stores the temp newID
00347   int newID;
00348 
00349   // renumbers and organises all Verts, Normals and Texture coords
00350   for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_lodTriangle.size(); ++i)
00351   {
00352 
00353     // stores all the new face data
00354     ngl::Face face;
00355 
00356     // Normal renumber: checks if the id has already been used, then adds the
00357     // coordinate value to m_norm followed by adding the new position ID to the
00358     // face
00359     for (unsigned int j=0; j<m_lodTriangle[i]->m_norm.size(); ++j)
00360     {
00361       if (oldNewIDNormMatch.find(m_lodTriangle[i]->getNormID(j)) == oldNewIDNormMatch.end())
00362       {
00363         // stores the normal value
00364         m_norm.push_back(m_lodTriangle[i]->m_norm[j]);
00365         newID = m_norm.size()-1;
00366         // stores the location of the normal value in m_norm
00367         face.m_norm.push_back(newID);
00368         // adds to map to stop multiple ids for the same value
00369         oldNewIDNormMatch[m_lodTriangle[i]->getNormID(j)]=newID;
00370       }
00371       else
00372       {
00373         // ID already used, so add to the face normal list the new ID
00374         face.m_norm.push_back(oldNewIDNormMatch[m_lodTriangle[i]->getNormID(j)]);
00375       }
00376     }
00377 
00378 
00379     // Texture coord renumber: checks if the id has already been used, then adds the
00380     // coordinate value to m_tex followed by adding the new position ID to the
00381     // face
00382     for (unsigned int j=0; j<m_lodTriangle[i]->m_tex.size(); ++j)
00383     {
00384       if (oldNewIDTexMatch.find(m_lodTriangle[i]->getTexID(j)) == oldNewIDTexMatch.end())
00385       {
00386         // stores the texture coord value
00387         m_tex.push_back(m_lodTriangle[i]->m_tex[j]);
00388         newID = m_tex.size()-1;
00389         // stores the location of the texture coord value in m_tex
00390         face.m_tex.push_back(newID);
00391         // adds to map to stop multiple ids for the same value
00392         oldNewIDTexMatch[m_lodTriangle[i]->getTexID(j)]=newID;
00393       }
00394       else
00395       {
00396         // ID already used, so add to the face texture coord the new ID
00397         face.m_tex.push_back(oldNewIDTexMatch[m_lodTriangle[i]->getTexID(j)]);
00398       }
00399     }
00400 
00401     // Verts renumber: checks if the id has already been used, then adds the
00402     // coordinate value to m_vert followed by adding the new position ID to the
00403     // face
00404     for (unsigned int j=0; j<m_lodTriangle[i]->m_vert.size(); ++j)
00405     {
00406       if (oldNewIDVtxMatch.find(m_lodTriangle[i]->m_vert[j]->getID()) == oldNewIDVtxMatch.end())
00407       {
00408         // stores the vert value
00409         m_verts.push_back(m_lodTriangle[i]->m_vert[j]->m_vert);
00410         newID = m_verts.size()-1;
00411         // stores the location of the texture coord value in m_vert
00412         // takes the value from the Vertex class ID
00413         face.m_vert.push_back(newID);
00414         // adds to map to stop multiple ids for the same value
00415         oldNewIDVtxMatch[m_lodTriangle[i]->m_vert[j]->getID()]=newID;
00416       }
00417       else
00418       {
00419         // ID already used, so add to the face vert the new ID
00420         face.m_vert.push_back(oldNewIDVtxMatch[m_lodTriangle[i]->m_vert[j]->getID()]);
00421       }
00422     }
00423     // stores the booleans and number of verts in face
00424     face.m_normals = m_lodTriangle[i]->m_normals;
00425     face.m_numVerts = face.m_vert.size()-1;
00426     face.m_textureCoord = m_lodTriangle[i]->m_textureCoord;
00427 
00428     // store the face in m_face
00429     m_face[i] = face;
00430   }
00431 
00432   // store the size of each list
00433   m_nVerts=m_verts.size();
00434   m_nNorm=m_norm.size();
00435   m_nTex=m_tex.size();
00436   m_nFaces=m_face.size();
00437 
00438   // copy the vertex and triangle data to the out variable
00439   copyVtxTriNormTexDataToOut();
00440 
00441   // store the collapse cost of the Vertices into an ordered list
00442   storeCollapseCostList();
00443 
00444   // calculate bbox and centre
00445   this->calcDimensions();
00446   this->createVAO();
00447 }

00449 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00450 void ModelLODTri::save(const std::string& _fname)const
00451 {
00452   // Open the stream and parse
00453   std::fstream fileOut;
00454   fileOut.open(_fname.c_str(),std::ios::out);
00455   if (!fileOut.is_open())
00456   {
00457     std::cout <<"File : "<<_fname<<" Not founds "<<std::endl;
00458     return;
00459   }
00460   // write out some comments
00461   fileOut<<"# This file was created by ngl Obj exporter "<<_fname.c_str()<<std::endl;
00462   // was c++ 11  for(Vec3 v : m_norm) for all of these
00463   // write out the verts
00464   BOOST_FOREACH(ngl::Vec3 v , m_verts)
00465   {
00466     fileOut<<"v "<<v.m_x<<" "<<v.m_y<<" "<<v.m_z<<std::endl;
00467   }
00468 
00469   // write out the tex cords
00470   BOOST_FOREACH(ngl::Vec3 v , m_tex)
00471   {
00472     fileOut<<"vt "<<v.m_x<<" "<<v.m_y<<std::endl;
00473   }
00474   // write out the normals
00475 
00476   BOOST_FOREACH(ngl::Vec3 v , m_norm)
00477   {
00478     fileOut<<"vn "<<v.m_x<<" "<<v.m_y<<" "<<v.m_z<<std::endl;
00479   }
00480 
00481   // finally the faces
00482   BOOST_FOREACH(ngl::Face f , m_face)
00483   {
00484   fileOut<<"f ";
00485   // we now have V/T/N for each to write out
00486   for(unsigned int i=0; i<=f.m_numVerts; ++i)
00487   {
00488     // don't forget that obj indices start from 1 not 0 (i did originally !)
00489     fileOut<<f.m_vert[i]+1;
00490     fileOut<<"/";
00491     fileOut<<f.m_tex[i]+1;
00492     fileOut<<"/";
00493 
00494     fileOut<<f.m_norm[i]+1;
00495     fileOut<<" ";
00496   }
00497   fileOut<<std::endl;
00498   }
00499 }
00500 
00501 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00502 float ModelLODTri::calculateEColCost( Vertex* _u, Vertex* _v)
00503 {
00504   ngl::Real edgeLength = (m_verts[_v->getID()] - m_verts[_u->getID()]).length();
00505   ngl::Real curvature = 0;
00506 
00507   std::vector<Triangle *> sideFaces;
00508 
00509   // Find what triangles are adjacent to both vertices
00510   for (unsigned int i=0; i < _u->m_faceAdj.size(); ++i)
00511   {
00512     if(_u->m_faceAdj[i]->hasVert(_v))
00513     {
00514       sideFaces.push_back(_u->m_faceAdj[i]);
00515     }
00516   }
00517 
00518   // use the triangle facing most away from the this side faces
00519   // to determine the curvature term
00520   for (unsigned int i=0; i < _u->m_faceAdj.size(); ++i)
00521   {
00522     float minCurve=1; // Curve for face i and the closer side to it
00523     for (unsigned int j=0; j < sideFaces.size(); ++j)
00524     {
00525       float dotprod = _u->m_faceAdj[i]->getFaceNormal().dot(sideFaces[j]->getFaceNormal());
00526       minCurve = fmin(minCurve, (1-dotprod)/2.0f);
00527     }
00528     curvature = fmax(curvature, minCurve);
00529   }
00530   // the more coplanar the lower the curvature term
00531   return edgeLength * curvature;
00532 }
00533 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00534 void ModelLODTri::calculateEColCostAtVtx( Vertex* _v)
00535 {
00536   if (_v->m_vertAdj.size() == 0)
00537   {
00538     // v doesn't have any adjacent vertices and so it costs nothing to collapse
00539     _v->setCollapseVertex(NULL);
00540     _v->setCollapseCost(FLT_MIN);
00541     return;
00542   }
00543 
00544   // set pointer to NULL and to the highest value
00545   _v->setCollapseVertex(NULL);
00546   _v->setCollapseCost(FLT_MAX);
00547 
00548   // search all adjacent faces for the least cost edge collapse
00549   for (unsigned int i=0; i<_v->m_vertAdj.size(); ++i)
00550   {
00551     float cost = calculateEColCost(_v, _v->m_vertAdj[i]);
00552     if (cost < _v->getCollapseCost())
00553     {
00554       // set the collapse Vertex and the collapse cost
00555       _v->setCollapseVertex(_v->m_vertAdj[i]);
00556       _v->setCollapseCost(cost);
00557     }
00558   }
00559 
00560 }
00561 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00562 void ModelLODTri::calculateAllEColCosts()
00563 {
00564   for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_verts.size(); ++i)
00565   {
00566     calculateEColCostAtVtx(m_lodVertex[i]);
00567   }
00568   // Deep copy all vertex and triangle values to their Out counterparts
00569   copyVtxTriNormTexDataToOut();
00570   storeCollapseCostList();
00571 }
00572 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00573 void ModelLODTri::collapseEdge(Vertex *_u, Vertex *_v)
00574 {
00575   if (!_v)
00576   {
00577     // u is a vertex by itself so just delete it
00578     delete _u;
00579     return;
00580   }
00581 
00582   // temp store adjacent verts
00583   std::vector<Vertex *> vertTmp = _u->m_vertAdj;
00584 
00585   for ( int i =_u->m_faceAdj.size()-1; i >= 0; --i)
00586   {
00587     if (_u->m_faceAdj[i]->hasVert(_v))
00588     {
00589       // set NULL in triangle out
00590       m_lodTriangleOut[_u->m_faceAdj[i]->getID()] = NULL;
00591       delete(_u->m_faceAdj[i]);
00592       // add to number of deleted faces
00593       m_nDeletedFaces += 1;
00594     }
00595   }
00596   for ( int i =_u->m_faceAdj.size()-1; i >= 0; --i)
00597   {
00598     // update remaining triangles to have v instead of u
00599     _u->m_faceAdj[i]->replaceVertex(_u,_v);
00600   }
00601   // delete the vertex _u
00602   delete _u;
00603 
00604   // recompute the edge collapse costs for adjacent verts for _v
00605   for ( unsigned int i=0; i < vertTmp.size(); ++i)
00606   {
00607     calculateEColCostAtVtx(vertTmp[i]);
00608   }
00609 
00610 }
00611 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00612 vtxTriData ModelLODTri::copyVtxTriData(std::vector<Vertex *> _vtxData ,std::vector<Triangle *> _triData)
00613 {
00614   std::vector<Vertex *> newVtxData;
00615   std::vector<Triangle *> newTriData;
00616   // resize the vector to the required size if necessary
00617   newVtxData.resize(_vtxData.size());
00618   newTriData.resize(_triData.size());
00619 
00620   for ( unsigned int i=0; i < fmax( _vtxData.size(), _triData.size()); ++i )
00621   {
00622     // copy the data and create a new pointer for each vertex
00623     if (i < _vtxData.size())
00624     {
00625       newVtxData[i] = _vtxData[i]->clone();
00626       // Resize the Adjacent Vert and Face vectors
00627       newVtxData[i]->m_vertAdj.resize(_vtxData[i]->m_vertAdj.size());
00628       newVtxData[i]->m_faceAdj.resize(_vtxData[i]->m_faceAdj.size());
00629     }
00630     if (i < _triData.size())
00631     {
00632       newTriData[i] = _triData[i]->clone();
00633       // Resize the triangle vert Vector
00634       newTriData[i]->m_vert.resize(_triData[i]->m_vert.size());
00635     }
00636   }
00637 
00638   // Storing the new adjacent vertex and faces
00639   for (unsigned int i=0; i < _vtxData.size(); ++i)
00640   {
00641     // copy over the collapsevertex from the new out Vector
00642     newVtxData[i]->setCollapseVertex(newVtxData[_vtxData[i]->getCollapseVertex()->getID()]);
00643     // iterate though the adjacent vertices and triangles for the new cloned for out Vector
00644     for (unsigned int j=0; j< fmax(_vtxData[i]->m_vertAdj.size(), _vtxData[i]->m_faceAdj.size()); ++j)
00645     {
00646       if (j < _vtxData[i]->m_vertAdj.size())
00647       {
00648         newVtxData[i]->m_vertAdj[j] = newVtxData[_vtxData[i]->m_vertAdj[j]->getID()];
00649       }
00650       if (j < _vtxData[i]->m_faceAdj.size())
00651       {
00652         newVtxData[i]->m_faceAdj[j] = newTriData[_vtxData[i]->m_faceAdj[j]->getID()];
00653       }
00654     }
00655   }
00656 
00657   // Storing the new triangle vertices
00658   for (unsigned int i=0; i < _triData.size(); ++i)
00659   {
00660     for (unsigned int j=0; j < _triData[i]->m_vert.size(); ++j)
00661     {
00662       newTriData[i]->m_vert[j] = newVtxData[_triData[i]->m_vert[j]->getID()];
00663     }
00664   }
00665 
00666   // group the data to be returned as one value in a struct
00667   vtxTriData returnData;
00668 
00669   returnData.vtxData = newVtxData;
00670   returnData.triData = newTriData;
00671 
00672   return returnData;
00673 }
00674 
00675 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00676 void ModelLODTri::copyVtxTriNormTexDataToOut()
00677 {
00678   // clear all data currently in the out vectors
00679   clearVtxTriDataOut();
00680 
00681   vtxTriData outData;
00682   outData = copyVtxTriData(m_lodVertex, m_lodTriangle);
00683 
00684   m_lodVertexOut = outData.vtxData;
00685   m_lodTriangleOut = outData.triData;
00686 
00687 }
00688 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00689 void ModelLODTri::clearVtxTriDataOut()
00690 {
00691   // iterate through both vertexOut and triangleOut, deleting the values
00692 
00693   for ( unsigned int i=0; i < m_lodVertexOut.size(); ++i)
00694   {
00695     delete(m_lodVertexOut[i]);
00696   }
00697 
00698   for ( unsigned int i=0; i < m_lodTriangleOut.size(); ++i)
00699   {
00700     delete(m_lodTriangleOut[i]);
00701   }
00702 }
00703 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00704 void ModelLODTri::clearCollapseCostList()
00705 {
00706   m_lodVertexCollapseCost.clear();
00707 }
00708 
00709 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00710 void ModelLODTri::storeCollapseCostList()
00711 {
00712   clearCollapseCostList();
00713   for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_lodVertex.size(); ++i)
00714   {
00715     m_lodVertexCollapseCost.push_back(m_lodVertexOut[i]);
00716   }
00717   updateCollapseCostList();
00718 }
00719 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00720 void ModelLODTri::updateCollapseCostList()
00721 {
00722   m_lodVertexCollapseCost.sort(compareVertexCost);
00723 }
00724 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00725 
00726 
00727 //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00728 ModelLODTri *ModelLODTri::createLOD(const unsigned int _nFaces)
00729 {
00730   m_nDeletedFaces = 0;
00731   while (m_nDeletedFaces < m_nFaces - _nFaces)
00732   {
00733     // get the cheapest vertex from the front of the collapse cost list
00734     Vertex* cheapestVertex = m_lodVertexCollapseCost.front();
00735     // store the vertexID to set the pointer in m_lodVertexOut to null after
00736     int vtxID = cheapestVertex->getID();
00737     // erase the first value from the collapse cost list
00738     m_lodVertexCollapseCost.pop_front();
00739     // collapse the edge from the cheapestVertex to its collapseVertex
00740     collapseEdge(cheapestVertex, cheapestVertex->getCollapseVertex());
00741     // re-order the collapse cost list for the new collapse values
00742     updateCollapseCostList();
00743     // set the lodVertexOut value to NULL to clear them from the list after
00744     m_lodVertexOut[vtxID] = NULL;
00745   }
00746   // removing nulls from m_lodVertexOut
00747   for (int i=m_lodVertexOut.size()-1; i>= 0; --i)
00748   {
00749     if (!m_lodVertexOut[i])
00750     {
00751       m_lodVertexOut.erase(m_lodVertexOut.begin()+i);
00752     }
00753   }
00754   // removing nulls from m_lodTriangleOut
00755   for (int i=m_lodTriangleOut.size()-1; i>= 0; --i)
00756   {
00757     if (!m_lodTriangleOut[i])
00758     {
00759       m_lodTriangleOut.erase(m_lodTriangleOut.begin()+i);
00760     }
00761   }
00762 
00763   // renumber all the triangles
00764   for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_lodTriangleOut.size(); ++i)
00765   {
00766     m_lodTriangleOut[i]->setID(i);
00767   }
00768 
00769   // renumber all the vertices
00770   for (unsigned int i=0; i<m_lodVertexOut.size(); ++i)
00771   {
00772     m_lodVertexOut[i]->setID(i);
00773   }
00774 
00775   // copy the data to a new modelLODTri
00776   ModelLODTri* newLOD = new ModelLODTri(*this);
00777 
00778 
00779 
00780   return newLOD;
00781 }
